wikipedia_page.main: Paddy Wilson (born 25 June 1946), sometimes known as Pat Wilson, is a retired Scottish footballer who played in the Scottish League for Berwick Rangers, Raith Rovers, Dunfermline Athletic, Aberdeen and Cowdenbeath as an outside right. He was the first substitute to be utilised by Aberdeen in a competitive match. After his retirement as a player, Wilson managed Cowdenbeath.
